content.description:
IMAGE 1: RAJABAI TOWER, MUMBAI, INDIA

Source: Wikimedia Foundation

IMAGE 2: ELIZABETH TOWER, LONDON, UNITED KINGDOM

Source: Pixabay

Geographers study cultural traits, ideas, and practices and their diffusion across space and in places. These traits, ideas, and practices can change through a variety of processes.
content.question:
A. Explain how a shared practice contributes to the cultural landscape shown in Image 1.

B. Describe TWO ways that the process of globalization may produce new forms of cultural ideas and practices that affect a city’s cultural landscape.

C. Explain a limitation of using the images to understand how territoriality relates to the cultural landscape shown in Image 1 or Image 2.

D. Explain how the diffusion of the English language relates to cultural landscapes in India.

E. Explain the degree to which a cultural landscape can reflect a minority group’s level of self-determination.

frqParts.text:
A. Explain how a shared practice contributes to the cultural landscape shown in Image 1.

B. Describe TWO ways that the process of globalization may produce new forms of cultural ideas and practices that affect a city’s cultural landscape.

C. Explain a limitation of using the images to understand how territoriality relates to the cultural landscape shown in Image 1 or Image 2.

D. Explain how the diffusion of the English language relates to cultural landscapes in India.

E. Explain the degree to which a cultural landscape can reflect a minority group’s level of self-determination.

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Describe a relevant geographic concept, process, model, or theory in a specified context.
